snippet.title: Stars Reach Trailer 2024
snippet.description:
Long ago, an ancient alien civilization terraformed whole arms of the galaxy to create what they called their Garden. They left behind remnants of their technology and their robotic Servitors, who to this day follow the orders of their long-vanished masters to tend the Garden. They also left a legacy of genetic experimentation which includes…us.

⏬ Wishlist on Steam ⏬
https://store.steampowered.com/app/1925650/Stars_Reach/

🎮 Join the Playtest 🎮
https://starsreach.com/

🔰 Kickstarter 🔰
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/starsreach/stars-reach

Follow us on:
🔹 Discord ▸ https://discord.gg/starsreach
🔹 Reddit ▸ https://www.reddit.com/r/StarsReach/
🔹 Facebook ▸ https://www.facebook.com/Starsreachgame
🔹 Twitter (X) ▸ https://x.com/playstarsreach
🔹 Instagram ▸ https://instagram.com/playstarsreach
🔹 TikTok ▸ https://www.tiktok.com/@playstarsreach
🔹 Twitch ▸ https://www.twitch.tv/playstarsreach
🔹 Bluesky ▸ https://bsky.app/profile/playstarsreach.bsky.social

📜 About Stars Reach 📜

Brought to you by the designer of Ultima Online and Star Wars Galaxies, STARS REACH is all about fulfilling the promise of what online worlds can be.

It’s a single shardless galaxy full of living planets to explore, settle, and rule with your friends. Thousands of planets and space zones, each persistent whether you’re online or not, all connected into a single galactic online multiplayer game.

It’s a massively multiplayer sandbox RPG with a deep skill tree horizontal progression system, dozens of professions, and no classes, gender locks, or annoying rails. If you decide you want to change your build, just let some skills fall out of practice and go learn something else. It’s built for immersing you into an alternate world of adventure.

This huge galaxy won’t get in the way of having instant fun, though. Download your brainwaves into a clone body close to your friends. Have fun in a five-minute session – or spend hours decorating your house. It’s a modern online game that respects your time and preferred ways to play.

Music credit: "Call to Adventure" by Scott Buckley – released under CC-BY 4.0.
If you are a content creator using parts of this video for content, please include this credit line for the music credit.
